text:
ðŸ‡¬ðŸ‡· "Last Dance" by Stefania to be released on March 10th
The Greek broadcaster ERT has revealed the release date for their 2021 entry “Last Dance” by Stefania. The song will drop on March 10th!
“This is not the last dance”
The song is written by Dimitris Kontopoulos, Arcade and Sharon Vaughn â€“ who also wrote Stefaniaâ€™s 2020 entry, â€œSUPERG!RLâ€?. Initial reports say that the song has an â€œ80s popâ€? feel, much like the songs of Brit Award-winning artist Dua Lipa. The song sends an optimistic message that “this is not the last dance”.
Last February, ERT confirmed that Stefania would represent Greece at the 2020 Eurovision Song Contest. Of course, the contest was cancelled a month later. However, soon after in March, ERT confirmed that they planned to â€˜resume co-operationâ€™ with Stefania for the 2021 contest.
In preparation for this yearâ€™s contest, Stefania recorded five potential entries which were then judged by a committee set up by Greek broadcaster ERT. “Last Dance” was chosen for Stefania and the title was revealed on January 7th.
The song will be released on March 10th with the music video. Kostas Karydas has returned to direct the video, while Fokas Evangelinos will also reprise his role as the entryâ€™s creative director. On the Eurovision stage, Stefania will be joined by four dancers: George Papadopoulos, Nikos Koukakis, Markos Giakoumoglou and Costas Pavlopoulos.
Are you excited to hear “Last Dance”? Let us know! Be sure to stay updated by followingÂ @ESCXTRA on Twitter,Â @escxtra on InstagramÂ and liking ourÂ Facebook pageÂ for the latest updates!Â Also, be sure to subscribe toÂ our YouTube channelÂ to see our reactions to the news in the upcoming months.
